posts.post_content:
I have an artifact-based standard deck and this card is pure gold. My favorite pairing with this card is [Etched Champion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Etched Champion). When metalcraft is active (easy to achieve in a deck with 25+ artifacts), I suddenly have a 4/4 beater with protection from all colors.
  
   
This card also helps boost the fragile [Steel Overseer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Steel Overseer).
  
   
I give the card a 4.5/5, simply because it can be game-breaking in an artifact deck.
posts.html:
I have an artifact-based standard deck and this card is pure gold. My favorite pairing with this card is Etched Champion. When metalcraft is active (easy to achieve in a deck with 25+ artifacts), I suddenly have a 4/4 beater with protection from all colors.

This card also helps boost the fragile Steel Overseer.

I give the card a 4.5/5, simply because it can be game-breaking in an artifact deck.

Posted By: Kelptic183 (1/29/2012 11:51:32 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Tempered Steel easily tops other enchantment creature boosts ([Glorious Anthem](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glorious Anthem), [Honor of the Pure](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Honor of the Pure), [Intangible Virtue](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Intangible Virtue), [Mirari's Wake](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mirari's Wake), with the latter being a slight exception due to having a bonus triggered ability, with a higher cost to compensate). Plenty of games I've been swarmed on turn 1 with 3+ [Memnite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Memnite)s and turn 2 or 3 this is dropped. I get hit for 9-12 damage. There are very few answers before turn 4 against this. You can either waste things like Doom Blade against a creature that will easily be replaced in another turn, or you can drop a creature of your own, but unless it's a 3 power with first strike, it's not likely to do much.
posts.html:
Tempered Steel easily tops other enchantment creature boosts (Glorious Anthem, Honor of the Pure, Intangible Virtue, Mirari's Wake, with the latter being a slight exception due to having a bonus triggered ability, with a higher cost to compensate). Plenty of games I've been swarmed on turn 1 with 3+ Memnites and turn 2 or 3 this is dropped. I get hit for 9-12 damage. There are very few answers before turn 4 against this. You can either waste things like Doom Blade against a creature that will easily be replaced in another turn, or you can drop a creature of your own, but unless it's a 3 power with first strike, it's not likely to do much.

posts.post_content: This card is a perfect example of how elegant the color pie is. "Artifact creatures you control get/gain..." fits in blue, and "creatures you control get +2/+2" fits in green, but if this design had cost ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol) (or worse, ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Green or Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=GU&type=symbol)![Green or Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=GU&type=symbol)) it would've been aesthetically unpleasant. Halfway between blue and green, in white, this design fits like a glove.
posts.html:
This card is a perfect example of how elegant the color pie is. "Artifact creatures you control get/gain..." fits in blue, and "creatures you control get +2/+2" fits in green, but if this design had cost (or worse, ) it would've been aesthetically unpleasant. Halfway between blue and green, in white, this design fits like a glove.
